intro: Guilielma microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited guilielma, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to the southern United States, particularly Florida and the Caribbean. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds. It is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist, sandy soils.
